title: Valentin Bianchi 2015 Elsa Bianchi Malbec (Mendoza)
description: Sappy volatile berry and plum aromas lead to sharp citric palate. This tastes of sour plum and herbs, while oaky spice and clove notes rise up on the finish.

title: Casa Montes 2014 Ampakama Malbec (San Juan)
description: Uncommon exotic blueberry aromas are lean and grassy. In the mouth, this is high in acidity and scouring. Flavors match the nose, meaning this tastes sour and exotic, while the finish is sharp and scrubbing.

title: Cruz Alta 2014 Reserve Malbec (Mendoza)
description: Stewed, saucy aromas of grassy tomato and herbal berry fruits are foxy. This feels cutting and rough, while minty green-berry flavors come with a note of animal fur.

title: Weibel Family NV Peach Mango Demi-Sec Sparkling (California)
description: The peachy color of this bubbly wine is appropriate because the aromas and flavors are effusively peachy, too. It is light bodied, very sweet and has been flavored with something other than grapes.

title: Aguijón De Abeja 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Argentina)
description: Soft herbal berry aromas are minty and green. The palate on this young but raisiny Cabernet has a jammy cushion to it, while flavors of green bean, herbs and carob are not distinguished. A creamy feeling but tannic finish is chewy, chunky and weighty.

title: Caves du Val de Loire 2015 Jovly  (Vouvray)
description: This wine is off dry, with honey and lemon flavors cut with tight acidity. Young and fruity, this simple wine is ready to drink.

title: Marengo NV Brut Sparkling (Ukraine)
description: On the nose, this nonvintage sparkler from the Ukraine has primary notes of yeast and freshly baked bread There are soft flavors of green apple and peach in the mouth with gentle persistent bubbles.

title: Marengo NV Semi-Sweet Bianco Sparkling (Ukraine)
description: Persistent bubbles lead the way to aromas of citrus blossom, green apple and yeasty bread. There are flavors of apple juice and lemon preserves in the midpalate. The finish is pleasantly sweet.

title: L. Tramier & Fils NV Roncier Red (Vin de France)
description: This wine is an eclectic blend of Pinot Noir, Gamay, Mourvèdre and Grenache. The Pinot Noir's red fruits and smooth texture dominate, giving a soft wine with acidity and light tannins. Drink now.

title: Luigi Bosca 2016 Chardonnay (Luján de Cuyo)
description: Gold in color, with aromas of turpentine and wood resin, this is entirely defined by barrel-based aromas, flavors and mouthfeel. Nothing but oak and related clove, resin and bitterness is making a mark.

title: Prada A Tope 2015 Palacio de Canedo Maceración Ecológico Mencía (Bierzo)
description: There are only two words for this carbonic-macerated Mencía: Bug Juice. Aromas of wild-berry fruits are clumsy and wooly. This feels narrow, raw and choppy, with gritty plum and candied berry flavors that fall off on the finish.

title: Spiriterra 2014 Estate Muscadine Rosé (Napa Valley)
description: A rare finding of this variety in California, this wine is golden-orange in color and offers resin-like sweetness that may not appeal to everybody.

title: VGS Chateau Potelle 2015 Riviera Rosé (Sonoma County)
description: Made entirely from Cinsault, this copper-orange-colored wine comes in a swank square bottle, but delivers a tart, sour quality that veers slightly metallic.

title: Carol Shelton 2013 King Ridge Vineyard Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Coast)
description: There's something overripe and flat about this wine, which conveys a mix of Dr Pepper, chocolate and vanilla that doesn't impress.

title: Weibel Family NV Almond Demi-Sec Sparkling (California)
description: This wine smells like a Danish pastry, with strong, very sweet almond flavors that cling to the taste buds long after sipping.

title: Tercos 2015 Bonarda (Mendoza)
description: Unfocused, and jumbled aromas of clove, mint, latex and gritty oak barely allow for any fruit to show through. This is clampy and acidic. Roasted oaky plum and berry flavors finish jagged, with roasted flavors.

title: Lion-Gri 2011 Saperavi (Moldova)
description: This blend of Saperavi, Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot has prominent aromas of smoke and cured meats. There are flavors of red and black fruits and a touch of smoky sweetness in the finish.

title: Marengo NV Rose Sparkling (Ukraine)
description: This sparkling rosé has aromas of honeydew melon and dried red cherries. In the mouth, it has persistent bubbles, flavors of ripe strawberry and a sweet red-fruit finish.

title: Marengo NV Semi-Dry Sparkling (Ukraine)
description: This pale lemon sparkling wine has aromas of citrus flowers, brioche and yeast in the bouquet. It is slightly sweet on the palate with flavors of green apple, peach and sweet lime juice.

title: Michel Torino 2015 Coleccion Malbec (Calchaquí Valley)
description: Aromas of plastic and weedy berry fruits are not a draw. This feels dilute and pulling. Weedy, raw, tart red-berry flavors finish with green notes of mint and leafy herbs.

title: Pisano 2014 Río de los Pájaros Reserve Pinot Noir (Progreso)
description: Rusty in color and overdone on the nose, this Pinot smells charred and burnt out. Rough and abrasive in feel, with weedy herbal berry flavors, this tastes roasted and savory on the finish while leaving a lot to be desired.

title: Lion-Gri 2015 Château d'Or Sparkling Red Muscat (Moldova)
description: This sparkling red wine made from Muscat is cherry red in color. It has pleasant aromas and flavors of red raspberry, black cherry and sweet pomegranate juice. It could use a few more bubbles but it will satisfy the palates of wine drinkers looking for sweet red sparkling wines.

title: L. Tramier & Fils 2015 Collection  (Mâcon-Villages)
description: The wine is too rich, losing sight of the fruit. It is so soft, lightly spicy and feels heavy.

title: Love 2015 Moscato (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
description: Bland, sweet aromas are not persuasive. This feels cloying and sticky due to a lot of sugar and not much acidity. Soapy, sweet flavors finish with bitter notes.
region_1: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla

title: Quara 2014 Special Selection Cabernet Sauvignon (Cafayate)
description: Aromas of herbal berry are green and leafy. This feels wiry, lean and scouring due to sharp acidity and not much body. Stewy, herbal, candied berry flavors finish with a distinct herbal green character.

title: Marichal 2013 Reserve Collection Red (Canelones)
description: Pinot Noir blended with Tannat? Like it or not, here it is, and this unicorn wine from Uruguay smells cheesy and murky. A linear palate is not well padded, while this tastes earthy, like saucy plum and tomato.

title: Antonio Gonzalez 2012 Galan Reserva Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza)
description: Grassy, herbaceous, raisiny aromas are green and harsh. This is brutally tannic and out of whack on the palate, while green, weedy flavors finish thick, blocky and rough.

title: Bougrier 2015 Gamay-Grolleau  (Rosé d'Anjou)
description: This vivid pink-colored wine tastes of candy with added acidity. There is some sweetness along with the artificial flavors.

title: Haarth 2013 Made With Organic Grapes Cabernet Sauvignon (Argentina)
description: Gritty aromas of asphalt, licorice and especially clove are off the beaten path. Flavors of dried clove, pepper and wood smoke are dominant and don't allow for any fruit to show through. A finish that tastes like pure clove is in its own zip code. Tasted twice.

title: Krug 2002 Brut  (Champagne)
description: This is a fabulous wine from the greatest Champagne vintage so far this century. Still young, it blends almost equal amounts of Pinot Noir and Chardonnay fleshed out with Pinot Meunier. The minerality and the rich apple and green fruits are balanced, and acidity cuts into the wine with a pure, perfumed line of freshness. The wine could be drunk now, but it will age well into the the 2020s.
